critique: This executive order outlines the responsibilities of the Administrator of General Services in preparing for national emergencies. It covers a wide range of areas, including building management, utilities, communications, transportation, records, and supply support. There is no mention of immigration or social issues. The order expands executive power by centralizing control over emergency preparedness within the executive branch. It also strengthens federal control by assigning responsibilities to the Administrator of General Services. The order prioritizes national security by focusing on emergency preparedness and response. It also involves government intervention in economic matters by planning for emergency procurement and supply. There is no mention of social inclusion or diversity.
